page.title: 07FARMING
page.content: FARMING IN THE TALYBONT AREA Sheep and cows occupy most farms in the area.There's 32 farms in our block called Tanrallt,Berthlwyd,Cwmslaid, Alltgoch,Lletyllwyd,Bryngryffty, Argoed Fawr,Tynycae,Alltgoch Fach, Tynycoed,Stay Little,Brynadda,Llwyn- adda,Neuadd Fawr,Tyrhelig,Ty Hen, Cerrigmawr,Panteg,Tyngraig,Penyrhiw, Erglodd,Nantyllain,Cefn Erglodd,Moel- Goch,Ynys Capel,Llwynglas,Tynygwndwn, Glanrafon,Blaenant,Bwlchyddwyallt, Pempompren Uchaf.Welsh Blacks and Charolais are most common cows in the area,and Welsh Mountain sheep and Speckle face sheep are the most common sheep in the area.Every farm by now has a tractor,no one use horses. Most farms in the area are hill farms. The farmer's work include dipping, clipping,shearing,sileage making, hay making and ploughing the fields.
